nealrichardson commented on issue #4505: ARROW-3780 [R]: Failed to fetch data: invalid data when collecting int16
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4505#issuecomment-500504730
 
 
   Code deletion LGTM though my instinct is that we should just fold it in to some other patch since it's unrelated to either fixing this issue or testing that it was already fixed.
   
   @wesm https://github.com/rstudio/sparklyr/blob/master/.travis.yml#L61-L87 is where I'd start with getting the sparklyr setup. Developer docs aside, it's worth considering whether we want to set up some proper integration test with sparklyr. To start, we could pay attention to (and maybe see if we could wire up some notifications around) the integration tests that sparklyr is doing, which, as https://github.com/rstudio/sparklyr/pull/2032 shows, does catch things that we break.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Repro from sparklyr unit test:
{code:java}
library(dplyr)
library(sparklyr)
library(arrow)

sc <- spark_connect(master = "local")

hive_type <- tibble::frame_data(
 ~stype, ~svalue, ~rtype, ~rvalue, ~arrow,
 "smallint", "1", "integer", "1", "integer",
)

spark_query <- hive_type %>%
 mutate(
 query = paste0("cast(", svalue, " as ", stype, ") as ", gsub("\\(|\\)", "", stype), "_col")
 ) %>%
 pull(query) %>%
 paste(collapse = ", ") %>%
 paste("SELECT", .)

spark_types <- DBI::dbGetQuery(sc, spark_query) %>%
 lapply(function(e) class(e)[[1]]) %>%
 as.character(){code}
Actual: error: Failed to fetch data: invalid data
fields.summary: [R] Failed to fetch data: invalid data when collecting int16

comments.body:
I was pretty sure this non-specific error message was going to rear its ugly head

https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/202265fbb67685f1ed179ba080a85b48fbd53adc/r/src/arrow_types.h#L36
Keeping this open until it is unit tested
[~romainfrancois] can you add a unit test for this?
[~javierluraschi] do you still get the same message with the dev version of arrow ?
